head.title: June 25-July 1; Drug Benefits for the Elderly

hedline.hl1: June 25-July 1; Drug Benefits for the Elderly

block.p: Defying a veto threat from President Clinton, the House approved a Republican plan to provide prescription drug benefits to the elderly by offering subsidies to insurers to help defray the cost.

Republicans said they were responding to the pleas of Medicare beneficiaries but without creating a a ''big government'' program. Democrats denounced the plan as a sham, saying insurers would not offer drug coverage at an affordable price.
Defying a veto threat from President Clinton, the House approved a Republican plan to provide prescription drug benefits to the elderly by offering subsidies to insurers to help defray the cost.

Republicans said they were responding to the pleas of Medicare beneficiaries but without creating a a ''big government'' program. Democrats denounced the plan as a sham, saying insurers would not offer drug coverage at an affordable price.

The Senate will probably address the issue as elections approach. No one knows whether a new law will emerge this year, but experts say Congress will surely add drug benefits to Medicare within a few years.
